article_title: Thomas F. McLarty: How Obama Can Salvage His Last Two Years
article_text:
At several recent forums featuring White House chiefs of staff from the Reagan, Clinton and George W. Bush presidencies, I and my fellow West Wing veterans have fielded a question that seems inevitable in this season of discontent: Is the Obama presidency over?

The unanimous answer: not by a long shot. Every two-term president for a century has entered his last 24 months in office facing predictions of irrelevance, disarray and failure. Most have felt besieged by enemies and abandoned by some friends. “The pundits claimed...

twitter.description: In The Wall Street Journal, Thomas F. ‘Mack’ McLarty writes that the president faces complex crises, including Ebola and Islamic State. They require clear U.S. leadership.
twitter.title: How Obama Can Salvage His Last Two Years

article_summary:
Every two-term president for a century has entered his last 24 months in office facing predictions of irrelevance, disarray and failure.
At several recent forums featuring White House chiefs of staff from the Reagan, Clinton and George W. Bush presidencies, I and my fellow West Wing veterans have fielded a question that seems inevitable in this season of discontent: Is the Obama presidency over?
The unanimous answer: not by a long shot.
Most have felt besieged by enemies and abandoned by some friends.
